meanings.definition: Relating to the form or structure of organisms.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the morphological differences between the two species of birds.
meanings.sent2: The morphological features of the flower helped in identifying its species.
meanings.sent3: The morphological similarities between the two insects made them look like twins.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the trees had a morphological resemblance to giant sculptures.
meanings.sent5: The morphological characteristics of the rock formations were truly fascinating.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study of the form and structure of words.
meanings.sent1: The linguist conducted a morphological analysis of the ancient language.
meanings.sent2: Understanding morphological rules can help in language learning.
meanings.sent3: The students found the morphological study of words surprisingly enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: In literature, the author's use of morphological techniques was highly praised.
meanings.sent5: The morphological complexity of the language made translation challenging.
